titleStmt.title: Johnson A. Dawson et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8633

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his Excelency Jas F Robinson
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

The undersigned would Represent to your Excelency that ^at the^ Sept. Term of the Powell Circuit Court 1858 that the Commonwealth obtained a Judgement against John Woodward for unlawful gaming ^for thirty dollars^ and that J N B Hardwick to prevent him from going to Jail Repleved the Same for him

and they would further represent that Said Woodward has since left the State without Paying Said fine and that the Sheriff is now endevoring to make the Same out of Said Hardwick which if made will be very oppressive on him and we would humbly aske youre Excelency to remit Said fine.

J B Scholl
Johnson ,A, Dawson D S. P. C
John F. Hatten J P C
C D Creed C. P. C
M Steward
Thos C Judy C. P. T C

Powell Cir. Ct
One half remitted
J F Robinson
$30. } Gaming
John Woodward
Issd Feby 3d 1863
